You can manage the group flood settings from here.
1st row ‚Ä¢ ON/OFF: the current status of the anti-flood ‚Ä¢ Kick/Ban: what to do when someone is flooding
2nd row ‚Ä¢ you can use +/- to change the current sensitivity of the anti-flood system ‚Ä¢ the number is the max number of messages that can be sent in 5 seconds ‚Ä¢ max value: 25 - min value: 4
3rd row and below You can set some exceptions for the anti-flood: ‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ: the media will not be ignored by the anti-flood ‚Ä¢ ‚ùå: the media will be ignored by the anti-flood ‚Ä¢ Note: in "texts", all the other types of media (file, audio...) are included

{0} has been kicked for posting a not safe for work image.\nThe image had a {1}% chance of being NSFW

Set whether or not the user is kicked or banned. Turn the detection system on or off. Please note that each api key is limited to 5000 images a month, it is your responsability to change your groups api key when it is used up
This system works by only banning images with a 95% or higher chance of being NSFW. It uses the latest in computer vision technology but as this field is still young it is not perfect.
Here is a post about how to exactly set up NSFW detection: http://telegra.ph/Enforcer-NSFW-Image-Detection-Guide-05-15
Your options are below:
NSFW Detection

Users temp elevated by users

Enforcer is a bot designed to help make managing your groups easier. For updates go to https://t.me/greywolfdev. It does this by implementing antispam, anti media, tempbans, warnings, allowing you to set responses to hashtags etc. * This bot needs to be an admin of the group chat to function properly. * This bot functions best in supergroups. * It can be configured by sending it /menu. * This bot has many commands, to find out more information about a specific command send /help [command] EG: /help menu. To get a list of commands send /getcommands. * If you still need help click /support to join our support group.
The information for {0} has not yet been written, please join the /support group to find out more about it.

Can be used to remove a user from a group but allows them to come back. It can be used with an id, username or by replying to the person you want kicked.
Example: /{0} while replying to a user /{0} [User ID] /{0} [Username]

Can be used to add a warning to a user, you can set the action taken on max warns and the number of warns a user can get with the menu command.
Example: /{0} while replying to a user /{0} [User ID] /{0} [Username]

Can be used to ban a user from a group (they cannot come back). If it is used by reply, you can add a reason for the ban behind /{0} which will be shown in status command
Example: /{0} while replying to a user /{0} [Reason] while replying to a user /{0} [User ID] /{0} [Username]

Can be used to unban a user from a group which will allow them back kf they were previously banned or tempbanned.
Example: /{0} while replying to a user /{0} [User ID] /{0} [Username]

Can be used to temporary ban a user from a group, they will only be able to come back after the time is passed. The command works by banning the user from the group and then unbanning them after the stipulated time. Usage: You need to reply to the user you want banned. Then when using the command put the number of minutes after the command is sent. If no time is stipulated the bot will ban the user for an hour.
Example: /{0} 123 while replying to a user /{0} while replying to a user

Can be used to flag a message or call the group admins. If you reply to a message it is forwarded to the group admins along with the text inside your message. If there is no reply just your message is sent. The admins are presented with an inline menu of actions to take. In supergroups you can go to the message. Example: @{0} @{0} while replying to a user @{0} [reason] @{0} [reason] while replying to a user
/{0} /{0} while replying to a user /{0} [reason] /{0} [reason] while replying to a user

Stops the bot from sending you reports. Can also be used for other admins than yourself, with reply, or username or ID.
Example: /{0} /{0} while replying to a user /{0} [User ID] /{0} [Username]

Makes the bot send reports to a user again if they were previously turned off. Can also be used for other admins than yourself, with reply, or username or ID
Example: /{0} /{0} while replying to a user /{0} [User ID] /{0} [Username]

Marks a reported message as solved so that other admins know it has been sorted out.
Example: /{0} while replying to the message containing @admin /{0} [Report ID]

Allows a user to report using @admin if they were previously blocked.
Example: /{0} while replying to a user /{0} [User ID] /{0} [Username]

Blocks a user from using @admin.
Example: /{0} while replying to a user /{0} [User ID] /{0} [Username]

Sets the rules for the group. Users can see the with rules command.
Example: /{0} Do not be a horrible mean person

Set a description for the group, that users can see with about command.
Example: /{0} A group for trolololololols

Saves a message you reply to to your private chat with the bot.
Example: /{0} while replying to a message you want to save

Returns the Chat ID of the group, or the ID of a user you reply to.
Example: /{0} while replying to a user's message /{0}

Returns information about a user in a group, like, how many warns, kicks and bans did they get globally, and how many in this group.
Example: /{0} while replying to a user /{0} [User ID] /{0} [Username]

Saves an extra command. Extra commands are custom commands with custom reply, triggered by single words starting with a #. Everyone can send the trigger afterwards and the bot will reply the custom answer.
Example: /{0} #blabla while replying to some text or media /{0} #blabla This is an extra

Deletes an extra command that was defined before.
Example: /{0} #blabla

Sets the link of this group, necessary for using the link command. Must be followed by the group link of it is a private group.
Example: /{0} [Group Link] (private group) /{0} (public group)

Returns the current staus of the user in that group - member, admin, creator, kicked, banned, never seen.
Example: /{0} [User ID] /{0} [Username]

Defines a welcome message for a group, that is sent whenever a new user joins or is added to the group. However, if multiple users join in a row, only one welcome message per minute will be sent in a group to avoid spam.
In the text, you can use markdown (use "/help markdown" for more infos) and the following things:
$name - Is replaced with new user's name $username - Is replaced with new user's username $id - Is replaced with new user's ID $title - Is replaced with group name
You can also set a GIF as welcome message by replying to it with the command!
And if you want, you can compose your welcome mesage of about text [a], rules [r] and adminlist [m]. For that, you use /welcome [letters], for example "/welcome ar" will set the welcome message to about text plus rules.
To set the welcome message back to default, use "/welcome no"
Example: /{0} Welcome $name to $title! /{0} while replying to a gif /{0} [Text] while replying to a gif /{0} ar /{0} m /{0} [any composition of the letters a, r and m] /{0} no

Disables AntiFlood and persian detection for a user, Admins should use it in a group so it will ignore them.
Example: /{0} /{0} while replying to a user

Enables AntiFlood and persian detection for a user, only necessary if that user was disablewatched before.
Example: /{0} /{0} while replying to a user

See how many messages a certain user sent in this group yet.
Example: /{0} while replying to a user /{0} [User ID] /{0} [Username]

Elevates that user to be an admin of that group. If run by admin or elevated, only 30 minutes, if run by creator or auth, permanently. Elevated users have access to all admin commands, for example warn, kick, ban and tempban.
Example: /{0} while replying to a user /{0} [User ID] /{0} [Username]

Deelevates a currently elevated user, only for creator and auth. They can no longer use admin commands then.
Example: /{0} while replying to a user /{0} [User ID] /{0} [Username]

Auths a user. This means, the bot will see them as group creator, they can auth and deauth, and permanently elevate users.
Example: /{0} while replying to a user /{0} [User ID] /{0} [Username]

Blocks an admin from temporarily elevating other users. Auth and creator only command. Usually, every group admin can elevate users for 30 minutes, auth can avoid them with this command.
Example: /{0} while replying to an admin /{0} [Admin's User ID] /{0} [Admin's Username]

Deauths a user, so they can no longer auth, deauth and permanently elevate others. Auth only command.
Example: /{0} while replying to an auth /{0} [Auth's User ID] /{0} [Auth's Username]
How to use markdown: BOLD = <b>BOLD</b> ITALIC = <i>ITALIC</i> LINK = <a href="t.me/greywolfdev">LINK</a> MONOSPACE = <code>MONOSPACE</code>

Auto
Name length
Message length

Here you can change the settings that dicate how the bot handles long names and messages.
You can set the character limit by sending the following in the group chat: /maxnl [number of characters] - to change the max length of a name; /maxtl [number of characters] - to change the maximum number of characters in a message; /maxl [number of lines] - to change the maximum number of lines allowed in a message.
The reason you can set lines and characters is that some spammers send blank messages containing many lines. These messages will be below the character count but will still be spammy. --[Characters : lines]-- shown in button

You ask for help with the help command? A little recursive, but:
The help command can be used to get help with a command (like "/help warn") or a few other topics (like "/help markdown"). You can get a list of help topics with /helplist command. If nothing is specified, there will be a standard help message instead.
Example: /{0} /{0} [command (without "/")] /{0} [help topic from /helplist]

Defines the maximum length for a name of a user in that group. If one's name is longer than that value, they are automatically kicked/warned/banned (can be set in /menu under "Auto")
Example: /{0} 50

Defines the maximum length for messages in this group. If someone sends a message with more characters, they are automatically kicked/warned/banned (can be set in /menu under "Auto")
Example: /{0} 1024

Defines the maximum number of lines for messages in that group. If someone sends a message with more lines, they are automatically kicked/warned/banned (can be set in /menu under "Auto")
Example: /{0} 50
This command is only for enforcer's developers!

Add a new rule at the end of the current ones in the /rules.
Example: /{0} You must always troll others!

Some commands (/rules, /about, /adminlist, #extra commands) can be disabled to be sent in group. What happens if a command is disabled, is, that the bot will simply pm the message to the user who requested it.
The icons near the command will show the current status: ‚Ä¢ üë•: The bot will reply in the group. ‚Ä¢ üë§: The bot will reply in private.
